job description:

Are you passionate about “Life Changing Innovation”? As with Thomas Edison, we have a history of working with the world’s greatest innovators. We solve our customers’ most complex problems that others can’t or won’t. Collaboration, Creative Spirit and Career Development are just a few of the reasons world-class professionals choose Corning Incorporated for a career. Scope of the position:

Do you want to be part of a unique opportunity to join a growing team that is demonstrating value and driving business impact within Corning Incorporated? We are increasing our application of advanced analytics and expert systems to our growing manufacturing capabilities. New manufacturing measurements and controls systems provide vast amounts of untapped process and product data. Your responsibilities will include transforming our data assets into strong internal insights that drive strategic solutions to deliver large value impact. You will act as a key member of multi-disciplined teams solving diverse challenges as you work across the many businesses that comprise Corning.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Perform exploratory and targeted data analysis using commercial and open source data analytic software packages.
  • Apply multivariate statistical methods and machine learning techniques to find structure and value in both large and small data sets to identify key process input variables that can feed process control solutions.
  • Develop predictive/classification models for use in production and possible applications.
  • Successfully identify the real problem from the customer’s point of view to build and execute data analytic work plans.
  • Communicate technical analyses and results to division customers.
  • Write technical reports summarizing development, application, and validation of the technical analysis.
Travel Requirements:
  • Travel requirements will vary. Expected travel up to 20% both Domestic and International
Hours of work/work schedule/flex time:
  • Flexibility is required. Normal Business hours (8 – 5, M – F): however, you are expected to work hours necessary to achieve objectives including overtime, weekend, and off-shift
Required Education:
  • MS with 5+ years of experience or PhD in Controls Engineering, Mechanical Engineer, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or other quantitative disciplines.
Range of Required Skills:
  • Your passion, knowledge of, and experience applying multivariate statistical analysis algorithms including intelligent automation techniques for classification, regression, and clustering. For example decision trees, random forest, SVM, logistic regression, neural networks, k-means clustering, and Bayesian models.
  • Demonstrated experience with a broad base of analysis and visualization tools (i.e. Matlab, Python, R, SAS JMP, Tableau).
  • Your Ability to show the relevance of the applied techniques in manufacturing and prioritize work across multiple projects will be critical.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment across stages of innovations.
  • Ability to communicate the outcome of complex and/or technical concepts in a clear manner to a non-analytical group and take on challenges specific to analyzing disparate data sources.
  • Transition proof-of-concept analysis and models into deployed production applications
Range of Desired Skills:
  • Knowledge of relational databases and experience with SQL.
  • Familiarity with ETL tools for data extraction, data cleansing, and data manipulation.
  • Understanding of measurement system analysis (MSA) techniques and design of experiments.
  • Experience applying time series analysis (i.e. ARIMA, Fourier analysis).
  • Software development experience in C,C++, and/or C#.
  • Software version control experience (i.e. git).
  • Knowledge of deep learning techniques (i.e. CNN, RNN) and software packages such as TensorFlow, CNTK, Keras, etc.
  • Familiarity with big data ecosystem (Spark, Hadoop, HIVE, etc) and cloud based storage and compute environments (AWS, MS Azure)
